page.title: 19The New Avon Ring Road.
page.content: The Ring Road will take traffic from Bristol centre around the East,so people can get to work quicker and without getting caught in the rush hour .After many meetings and protests the Council chose a route which will cut across Hanham Hills. The Ring Road will be a very busy fast road.It will cost about Â£30 million.It will add to your mileage, but will be quicker for people going to work and it will take traffic out from Hanham.Sadly some Hanham houses will have to be destroyed. The road will bring new trade,jobs and also bring the death of lots of wildlife.It will destroy the enjoyment of walking dogs or recreation. Farmland will be lost. Can the wildlife be saved before they start building? by Emma ,Lee,Stephen,and Ryan(age 14)
